Meall na Teanga

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Meall na Teanga is a steep dome, one of the two Loch Lochy Munros, rising above the forestry as seen from the A82 on the opposite side of the loch. Its rounded summit has several satellite peaks, divided by scooped coires.

 You have not climbed Meall na Teanga.

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 918 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.28/5
Rating: 3.3/5 (57 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Sron a Choire Ghairbh & Meall na Teanga

Other routes and challenges

The route above from Kilfinnan is the most straightforward. Alternatively, a circuit can be made from Eas chia-aig falls, initially following a right of way, but this crosses boggy ground around the Allt Cam Bhealaich.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Invergarry & Knoydart Hotels

Invergarry & Knoydart B&B

Invergarry & Knoydart Cottages

Lochaber Hostels

There are 3376 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Meall na Teanga. They have contributed 67 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first. The rightmost column shows how many summits were included in their report, which may help you to find the most relevant reports.
